page.title: 09 Ibstock Bricks, Aldridge
page.content: The Brick and Tile business in Aldridge began because of vast deposits of Etruria marl found in the area. This brickmaking company was founded in 1874 and is the only one still working in Aldridge in 1985, now called "Ibstock Brick Aldridge Ltd." The factory produces 750,000 bricks of 20 different types each week, with prices between Â£100 and Â£170 for 1,000. A large majority of the products are used in civic developments, fire stations and public buildings. The company owns about 100 acres of clay bearing land. Marl is dug out of the quarry and through grinding processes is reduced from lumps to dust, which is taken to the Making department. Here it is mixed with water, formed into brick shape, extruded and cut into single bricks which are fired, then are cooled.
